info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 1 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Quinby to near Elliott. These storms were dropping slowly southward near 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding.
SOURCE...Radar indicated. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Florence, Darlington, Timmonsville, Lamar, Quinby, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Cartersville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Mechanicsville, Oats, Mcleod Regional Medical Center, Carolinas Hospital System - Cedar Tower, and Health South Rehabilitation Hospital.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 155 and 175.
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning is one of nature's leading killers.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN FLORENCE AND CENTRAL DARLINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT
